abstract: Lockheed Martin accepted plans to phase out the jet after a meeting with Defense Secretary Robert Gates, but some lawmakers may push for more planes to avoid job losses.
snippet: Lockheed Martin accepted plans to phase out the jet after a meeting with Defense Secretary Robert Gates, but some lawmakers may push for more planes to avoid job losses.
lead_paragraph: Lockheed Martin will accept the Pentagon’s plans to phase out the F-22 fighter jet and will not lobby Congress to build more of the expensive planes, a top executive said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Lockheed Won’t Fight Pentagon on F-22 Plan
headline.print_headline: Lockheed Won’t Fight Pentagon On Jet Plan
